div.head: TO THE GENTLEMEN OF THE INNES OF COVRT.
div.p:
CVrteous Gentlemen, it may please you intertaine with patience this poore pamphlet, vnworthy I confesse so worthy patronage, if I presume, I craue pardon: if offend, it is the first fruite of any my writings: if dislike, I can be but sory. Sweete Gentlemen, censure mildlie, as protectors of a poore stranger, iudge the best, as incouragers of a young beginner: So shall I make true report of your vndeserued fauours,
and you shall be your selues euer curteous. In this hope (if promise may goe for currant) I willingly make the same vnto you of a Pastorall yet vnfinished, that my purpose was to haue added (for varietie sake) to this little volume of Sonnets: the next tearme you may expect it. In the meane time I wholy relye on your gentle acceptance.
